    • Method Detail

      • parseInterval

        public static long parseInterval(java.lang.String input,
                 TimeIntervalUtils.DefaultUnit unit)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses the input as a time interval in JIRA-like syntax. Plain numbers without a unit are treated using the provided unit. When input is null or an empty string, null is returned. Returns the duration of the interval in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        input - a time interval formatted using JIRA-like syntax
        unit - the default unit
        Returns:
        duration of the interval in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • parseInterval

        public static long parseInterval(java.lang.String input)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses the input as a time interval in JIRA-like syntax. Plain numbers without a unit are considered to be milliseconds. When input is null or an empty string, null is returned. Returns the duration of the interval in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        input - a time interval formatted using JIRA-like syntax
        Returns:
        duration of the interval in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        parseInterval(String, DefaultUnit)

      • formatInterval

        public static java.lang.String formatInterval(java.lang.Long interval)
        Formats the given time interval in milliseconds using JIRA-like syntax.
        Parameters:
        interval -
        Returns:
        formatted interval
